name: Passive Venting Hack
desc:
Considered an offensive hack against a captain’s own ship, and recommended only slightly more than Safety Overrides, this modification replaces standard capacitors and active venting systems in favor of experimental, high-throughput hardware.
The new systems are incompatible with ships equipped with phase or shield systems, and the new capacitors are volatile and burn out quickly.
short: Disables venting, reduces flux capacity, increases flux dissipation.

name: Rolling Nines
desc: Superstitiously known as Rolling Nines by those that know of it, this system attaches a meter and flux coils to the ship's flux grid in an abominable manner. This system improves flux performance and automates venting, and got its name from how the statistics have so many nines.
short: Automatic and faster venting, penalized and capped overloads.

name: Hardflux Shielding Coils
desc: Of questionable safety, this modification utilizes specialized coils to increase EMP resistance equal to the percent of hardflux in the ship’s systems...but completely prevents any hardflux dissipation while shields are active. The coils also resonate badly with phase coils, making phase cloak upkeep scale proportionally.
short: EMP resistance, phase cost scaling with hardflux. Disables dissipation.

name: Phase-Stasis Coils Model A
desc:
One of a set of particularly egregious modifications of phase coils which cause a ship to become more firmly anchored in linear time while phased.
Pilots may encounter brief disorientation before the system fully engages.
short: Phase timeflow and speed removed, upkeep increased.

name: Phase-Stasis Coils Model B
desc:
One of a set of particularly egregious modifications of phase coils which cause a ship to become more firmly anchored in linear time while phased.
Pilots may encounter brief disorientation before the system fully engages.
short: Phase timeflow removed, upkeep decreased.

name: Phase-Stasis Coils Model C
desc:
One of a set of particularly egregious modifications of phase coils which cause a ship to become more firmly anchored in linear time while phased.
Pilots may encounter brief disorientation before the system fully engages. Pilots should not, under any circumstances, interact with any versions of themselves they see on board.
short: Phase timeflow removed abstractly, upkeep increased.

name: Buttercup Time Reactor
desc:
A seemingly counter-intuitive temporal reactor with an odd name, the Buttercup is named after the first test subject for the project, a dairy cow, who is still in temporal stasis to this day.
This reactor multiplies the relative timeflow of the ship by %s and peak performance time by %s. It also multiplies all incoming damage by %s.
short: Timeflow down, peak performance up, total timeflow is DR.

name: Phase-Quantum Plating
desc:
Nicknamed the Peanut Shell for some reason, this modification replaces much of the hull’s structural support with a nightmarish mix of phase coils and shield emitters to quantum-superimpose extra plating onto the ship.
Someone drew a partially crushed skull on the instructions with ZF in the middle of it.
short: Turns ship into slow, expensive ball of armor

name: Superposition Lens
desc:
A bizarre quantum superposition system that massively amplifies beam weapons, while putting a massive strain on other weapon systems on the ship.
Also apparently can toast bread to perfection, somehow.
short: Beam damage, cost, turn speed up, range down. All RoF down.

name: Phase-Warped Anchor
desc:
This version of the phase anchor is incompatible with the normal version, and only works on automated ships, but does not distort space like the normal version does.
The installation notes also say that it is somehow incompatible with doing the fishstick, but installation somehow requires doing so.
short: Emergency dive maneuver. Remove cloak activation cost.

name: Phase-Stasis Coils Model O
desc:
An impossible to replicate version of phase-stasis coils which causes a ship to become more firmly anchored in linear time while phased.
Crew boarding the ship have reported hearing phantom singing and experiencing crippling migraines.
short: Phase timeflow removed abstractly, upkeep increased.

name: AI Core Fighter Uplink
desc:
The ship’s AI Core is extended to fighters before combat. Increases deployment cost by %s.
No, the fighter cores cannot make coffee. They can, however, make toast.
short: Copies AI core captain to fighters.

name: Harmonic Weapon Integration: Ballistic
desc:
This unstable rework of weapon integration systems drastically changes how they interface with a ship, allowing most weapons to be equipped much more readily...but the tradeoff is an overworked flux grid.
It also causes occasional harmless static shocks.
short: Massive OP reduction. Penalty multiplier to flux cost by base OP.

name: Harmonic Weapon Integration: Energy
desc:
This unstable rework of weapon integration systems drastically changes how they interface with a ship, allowing most weapons to be equipped much more readily...but the tradeoff is an overworked flux grid.
It also causes occasional harmless static shocks.
short: Massive OP reduction. Penalty multiplier to flux cost by base OP.

name: Harmonic Weapon Integration: Missile
desc:
This unstable rework of weapon integration systems drastically changes how they interface with a ship, allowing most weapons to be equipped much more readily...but the tradeoff is an overworked flux grid.
It also causes occasional harmless static shocks.
short: Massive OP reduction. Penalty multiplier to flux cost by base OP.

name: Artillery Module: Ballistic
desc:
A system designed to amplify the range of weapons substantially. Any systems that reduce ordnance point costs to zero will cause all affected weapons to strain the ship’s flux systems.
Next crewmember to fire anything other than ordnance out of the launchers will be the next projectile. Yes, Kevin, this means you if you’re reading this.
short: Massive range boost. Large OP cost increase.

name: Artillery Module: Energy
desc:
A system designed to amplify the range of weapons substantially. Any systems that reduce ordnance point costs to zero will cause all affected weapons to strain the ship’s flux systems.
Next crewmember to fire anything other than ordnance out of the launchers will be the next projectile. Yes, Kevin, this means you if you’re reading this.
short: Massive range boost. Large OP cost increase.

name: Artillery Module: Missile
desc:
A system designed to amplify the range of weapons substantially. Any systems that reduce ordnance point costs to zero will cause all affected weapons to strain the ship’s flux systems.
Next crewmember to fire anything other than ordnance out of the launchers will be the next projectile. Yes, Kevin, this means you if you’re reading this.
short: Massive range boost. Large OP cost increase.

name: Unstable Artillery Module: Ballistic
desc:
A system designed to amplify the range of weapons substantially. Any systems that reduce ordnance point costs to zero will cause all affected weapons to strain the ship’s flux systems.
Do not touch the coils.
short: Massive range boost. OP cost increase. Overload at 80% flux.

name: Unstable Artillery Module: Energy
desc:
A system designed to amplify the range of weapons substantially. Any systems that reduce ordnance point costs to zero will cause all affected weapons to strain the ship’s flux systems.
Do not touch the coils.
short: Massive range boost. OP cost increase. Overload at 80% flux.

name: Unstable Artillery Module: Missile
desc:
A system designed to amplify the range of weapons substantially. Any systems that reduce ordnance point costs to zero will cause all affected weapons to strain the ship’s flux systems.
Do not touch the coils.
short: Massive range boost. OP cost increase. Overload at 80% flux.

name: Fighter Defense Extender
desc:
Fighter manufactory override to boost fighter defenses.
Somehow, it still does not noticeably increase pilot survival rates.
short: enhances fighter phase/shield

name: Luddic Torch
desc:
Increases explosion radius by %s, increasing by %s per D-Mod. Increases explosion damage by %s, increasing by %s per D-Mod. Ship takes %s hull damage per second until at 1 hull remaining. Ship is nearly guaranteed to be recoverable when destroyed, and nearly guaranteed to gain a D-Mod.
Using the ship as a light source in space is ill-advised.

name: Luddic Smite
desc:
Increases explosion radius by %s, increasing by %s per D-Mod. Increases explosion damage by %s, increasing by %s per D-Mod. Ship takes %s hull damage per second until at 1 hull remaining. Ship is nearly guaranteed to be recoverable when destroyed, and nearly guaranteed to gain a D-Mod.
This hullmod is the Luddic Torch’s bigger, deadlier brother. Its extensive overhaul causes many forms of hull repair to simply cease functioning. It also amplifies maximum turn rate and turn acceleration by %s, and ship speed and acceleration by %s, the closer it is to destruction.
Using the ship as a light source in space is ill-advised.

name: The Otto Shield
desc:
A low level AI system that overrides shield control systems, multiplying shield unfold rate by %s, and turn rate by %s, but forcing the shields to remain active until the ship overloads or vents.
There is a name plastered over every page of the design documents. The last page has a footnote: Yes, it’s me, Otto! I did it!
short: Double shield unfold and turn, shields forced on.

name: Otto Phase Coils
desc: A substantial system rework of phase ships that effectively replaces the phase system and forces it on until it overloads, while rendering nearly any attempts to use weapons on the ship impossible. Allows Zero-Flux at any level, but doubles overload duration and crew losses. There is a name plastered over every page of the design documents. The last page has a footnote: Yes, it’s me, Otto! I did it!
short: Disables weapons, forces phase on, replaces flux system

name: The Otto System
desc: A shipsystem modification suite for the irate commander, causing %s faster cooldown. The last page is clearly a photograph of some kind of parchment, with some text written in what appears to be dried blood: It’s me, Otto, my crew has killed me for this.
short: Automatically uses shipsystem. Faster shipsystem cooldown.

name: Specialized Regenerative Hullmatrix
desc: This ship’s internal machinery rejects nearly all human presence, multiplying minimum and maximum crew by %s. If captained by an officer, the rebellious systems increase fuel and supply costs per month and sensor profile by %s. It will also automatically repair any lasting damage. The ship will almost always be recoverable.
short: immune to dmods, cannot be crewed

name: Phase Resonance Shielding
desc: This ship’s core housing has specialized harmonic shielding that allows AI cores to exist for extended periods of time in phase-space. Any attempts to study the shielding have resulted in the offender being teleported to a random place in the ship, devoid of clothing.

name: Meteor Drive Subsystem
desc: This ship has been outfitted with several poorly understood pieces of equipment, including what appears to be a jury-rigged mix of phase coils and a damper system, all hooked up to the system’s burn drive. The result is simultaneously horrifying and awe-inspiring; by diverting all power from the ship’s other systems, the ship is able to accelerate to much greater speeds while being nigh-invulnerable, as well as gaining immense mass. Until it flames out and overloads, anyway.
